intro: Heliotropium majus, commonly known as the "touch-me-not" or "bladderworts," is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are prostrate or ascending. Heliotropium majus is also known for its ability to produce small, inflated seed pods that burst open to disperse seeds.
